intro: Pentachaeta orcuttii, commonly known as Orcutt's pentachaeta, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
